p: The main constituents of MEO as shown by current results were 1,8-cineole, α-pinene, linalool, α-terpineol, nonadecane, linalyl acetate, and β-phellandrene. The potent antibacterial activity of EOs has mostly been related to oxygenated terpenes, such as 1,8-cineole, linalool and α-terpineol. Randrianarivelo, et al. demonstrated that potent antibacterial activity of MEO can be related to 1,8-cineole and linalool components ( 28). Moreover, linalool has previously been reported to be an antimicrobial agent ( 29).
